intro: Scirpus subdistichus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bulrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland environments. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces spike-like inflorescences that bear small, three-lobed flowers. Scirpus subdistichus is often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds and lakes. Its ability to thrive in saturated soils makes it an important component of aquatic and wetland ecosystems.
